intro: Melandrium lankongense, commonly known as the Lankong catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and grasslands. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white in color. Its leaves are opposite and linear, with a hairy texture that helps it retain moisture in arid environments.
